The Best Screenplay Award () is an award presented by the Jury to the best screenwriter for their work on a film of the Official Selection of the Cannes Film Festival.
History
It was first awarded to Alfred L. Werker,  &  for Lost Boundaries (1949).
Winners Denys Arcand for The Barbarian Invasions (2003),  &  for  (2021) and Coralie Fargeat for The Substance were later nominated Academy Awards for their screenplays.
